{"duration": "PT55S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Fluctuating Finite Element Analysis (FFEA): A continuum mechanics software tool for mesoscale simulation of biomolecules. Albert Solernou et al (2018), PLoS Comput Biol https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005897\n\nFluctuating Finite Element Analysis (FFEA) is a software package designed to perform continuum mechanics simulations of proteins and other globular macromolecules. It combines conventional finite element methods with stochastic thermal noise, and is appropriate for simulations of large proteins and protein complexes at the mesoscale (length-scales in the range of 5 nm to 1 \u03bcm), where there is currently a paucity of modelling tools. It requires 3D volumetric information as input, which can be low resolution structural information such as cryo-electron tomography (cryo-ET) maps or much higher resolution atomistic co-ordinates from which volumetric information can be extracted. In this article we introduce our open source software package for performing FFEA simulations which we have released under a GPLv3 license. The software package includes a C ++ implementation of FFEA, together with tools to assist the user to set up the system from Electron Microscopy Data Bank (EMDB) or Protein Data Bank (PDB) data files. We also provide a PyMOL plugin to perform basic visualisation and additional Python tools for the analysis of FFEA simulation trajectories. This manuscript provides a basic background to the FFEA method, describing the implementation of the core mechanical model and how intermolecular interactions and the solvent environment are included within this framework. We provide prospective FFEA users with a practical overview of how to set up an FFEA simulation with reference to our publicly available online tutorials and manuals that accompany this first release of the package.\n\nGood channel: https://www.youtube.com/Dlium\nSubscribe, like and comment.\n\nGood website: https://www.dlium.com\nBookmark, subscribe and comment.", "channelTitle": "ScienceVio", "tags": ["PLoS Comput Biol", "Biochemical simulations", "Viscosity", "Finite element analysis", "Software tools", "Biophysical simulations", "Simulation and modeling", "Deformation", "Macromolecules"], "defaultAudioLanguage": "en", "publishedAt": "2018-03-23T19:32:35Z", "channelId": "UC32BboXfQ_tDCV8y1ttx7cg", "title": "Fluctuating Finite Element Analysis (FFEA): A continuum mechanics software tool for mesoscale"}, "id": "Q342ngl9dtQ", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "107", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "0"}}]}, {"q": "10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005955", "idx_paper": "10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005955", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT51M"}, "snippet": {"description": "Sortir de la pi\u00e8ce sans sortir du cercle magique dans un serious escape game. Le 3e webinaire du collectif associatif Escape N'Games anim\u00e9 par Antoine Taly.", "title": "Webinaire Antoine Taly", "publishedAt": "2019-10-10T18:02:36Z", "channelTitle": "collectif Escape n' games", "channelId": "UCe15mpAKxmavCZAmWdiFsuQ"}, "id": "607VqdpDOuU", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "142", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "2"}}]}, {"q": "10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005977", "idx_paper": "10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005977", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT1M"}, "snippet": {"description": "Modeling the dynamics of oligodendrocyte precursor cells and the genesis of gliomas. Aloys Dufour et al (2018), PLoS Comput Biol https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005977\n\nOligodendrocyte precursor cells (OPCs) have remarkable properties: they represent the most abundant cycling cell population in the adult normal brain and they manage to achieve a uniform and constant density throughout the adult brain. This equilibrium is obtained by the interplay of four processes: division, differentiation or death, migration and active self-repulsion. They are also strongly suspected to be at the origin of gliomas, when their equilibrium is disrupted. In this article, we present a model of the dynamics of OPCs, first in a normal tissue. This model is based on a cellular automaton and its rules are mimicking the ones that regulate the dynamics of real OPCs. The model is able to reproduce the homeostasis of the cell population, with the maintenance of a constant and uniform cell density and the healing of a lesion. We show that there exists a fair quantitative agreement between the simulated and experimental parameters, such as the cell velocity, the time taken to close a lesion, and the duration of the cell cycle. We present three possible scenarios of disruption of the equilibrium: the appearance of an over-proliferating cell, of a deadless/non-differentiating cell, or of a cell that lost any contact-inhibition. We show that the appearance of an over-proliferating cell is sufficient to trigger the growth of a tumor that has low-grade glioma features: an invasive behaviour, a linear radial growth of the tumor with a corresponding growth velocity of less than 2 mm per year, as well a cell density at the center which exceeds the one in normal tissue by a factor of less than two. The loss of contact inhibition leads to a more high-grade-like glioma. The results of our model contribute to the body of evidence that identify OPCs as possible cells of origin of gliomas.\n\nGood channel: https://www.youtube.com/Dlium\nSubscribe, like and comment.\n\nGood website: https://www.dlium.com\nBookmark, subscribe and comment.", "channelTitle": "ScienceVio", "tags": ["PLoS Comput Biol", "Glioma", "Cell differentiation", "Cell cycle and cell division", "Precursor cells", "Cell migration", "Homeostasis"], "defaultAudioLanguage": "en", "publishedAt": "2018-03-28T19:20:32Z", "channelId": "UC32BboXfQ_tDCV8y1ttx7cg", "title": "Modeling the dynamics of oligodendrocyte precursor cells and the genesis of gliomas"}, "id": "17oYF1jELXw", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "34", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "1", "likeCount": "2"}}]}, {"q": "10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005995", "idx_paper": "10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005995", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT1M46S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Bat detective\u2014Deep learning tools for bat acoustic signal detection. Oisin Mac Aodha et al (2018), PLoS Comput Biol https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005995\n\nPassive acoustic sensing has emerged as a powerful tool for quantifying anthropogenic impacts on biodiversity, especially for echolocating bat species. To better assess bat population trends there is a critical need for accurate, reliable, and open source tools that allow the detection and classification of bat calls in large collections of audio recordings. The majority of existing tools are commercial or have focused on the species classification task, neglecting the important problem of first localizing echolocation calls in audio which is particularly problematic in noisy recordings. We developed a convolutional neural network based open-source pipeline for detecting ultrasonic, full-spectrum, search-phase calls produced by echolocating bats. Our deep learning algorithms were trained on full-spectrum ultrasonic audio collected along road-transects across Europe and labelled by citizen scientists from www.batdetective.org. When compared to other existing algorithms and commercial systems, we show significantly higher detection performance of search-phase echolocation calls with our test sets. As an example application, we ran our detection pipeline on bat monitoring data collected over five years from Jersey (UK), and compared results to a widely-used commercial system. Our detection pipeline can be used for the automatic detection and monitoring of bat populations, and further facilitates their use as indicator species on a large scale. Our proposed pipeline makes only a small number of bat specific design decisions, and with appropriate training data it could be applied to detecting other species in audio. A crucial novelty of our work is showing that with careful, non-trivial, design and implementation considerations, state-of-the-art deep learning methods can be used for accurate and efficient monitoring in audio.\n\nGood channel: https://www.youtube.com/Dlium\nSubscribe, like and comment.\n\nGood website: https://www.dlium.com\nBookmark, subscribe and comment.", "channelTitle": "ScienceVio", "tags": ["PLoS Comput Biol", "Echolocation", "Acoustics", "Algorithms", "Bats", "Bioacoustics", "Audio signal processing", "Neural networks", "Acoustic signals"], "defaultAudioLanguage": "en", "publishedAt": "2018-03-08T19:21:22Z", "channelId": "UC32BboXfQ_tDCV8y1ttx7cg", "title": "Bat detective\u2014Deep learning tools for bat acoustic signal detection"}, "id": "QfNjYjUoKqM", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "251", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "2"}}]}, {"q": "10.1002/rob.21733", "idx_paper": "10.1002/rob.21733", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT3M31S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Detailed information is now available in the format of a journal paper at http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/rob.21733/full", "title": "Behaviour-based emergency sound source localization system", "publishedAt": "2017-11-02T09:50:26Z", "channelTitle": "Meysam Basiri", "channelId": "UC3XWKZJbTW5sdjnp2dNQOHA"}, "id": "fVDhEIDX76w", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "114", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "0"}}]}, {"q": "10.1002/rob.21736", "idx_paper": "10.1002/rob.21736", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT2M30S"}, "snippet": {"description": "More information: R. "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT12M33S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Bilaterians, the kind of creature we are most familiar with, have dominated the Animal Kingdom for well over half a billion years. But for tens of millions of years, they were just an odd collection of tiny bottom feeders. However, once bilateral symmetry evolved, it was poised and ready to seize the stage. This moment in time is known as \u201cthe Cambrian Explosion\u201d.  But how exactly did bilaterians manage to take over in the end? What kickstarted the Cambrian Explosion and can we expect the same thing to happen in alien biospheres? Was the Cambrian Explosion destined to happen or just a fortunate fluke? Would bilaterally symmetrical animals always evolve on Earth-like worlds? "PT5M6S"}, "snippet": {"description": "This video summary captures highlights of Dr. Bandar AlMnagour\u2019s pioneering research in the field of additive manufacturing, popularly known as 3D printing. A specific additive manufacturing technique called \u201cselective laser melting\u201d can be used to enhance the material properties of steel by using steel matrix nanocomposites. The video walks you through the various experiments on reinforcement content, laser energy density, and scanning strategy carried out by Dr. AlMangour and colleagues and showcases the highlights of nine publications in international titles.\n\nRead the publications covered: \n\n1) In-situ formation of novel TiC-particle-reinforced 316L stainless steel bulk-form composites by selective laser Twenty of the roughly 500 known amino acids appear in the genetic code, and, when strung together into long chains, form the basic building blocks of proteins. \n\nFaint Young Sun Paradox \u2013 describes the apparent contradiction between evidence for a warm ancient Earth, and stellar models, which predict that the young Sun was 25% dimmer than today's Sun. First described by Carl Sagan and George Mullen in 1972.\n\nThe Miller\u2013Urey experiment \u2013 a landmark experiment in the 1950s in which scientists demonstrated that amino acids could form spontaneously from inorganic gases present in Earth's early atmosphere\n\nSnowball Earth \u2013 a climatic state of Earth in which the entire surface becomes frozen over. \n\nMolecules featured in this video:\n- Carbon dioxide (CO2)\n- Methane (CH4)\n- Nitrous oxide (N20)\n- Hydrogen cyanide (HCN)\n- Amino acids (especifically threonine, valine, cysteine and methionine)\n- Adenine (C5H5N5)\n- Glycine (C2H5NO2)\n\n\n___________________________________________\n\nReferences:\n\nAirapetian, V. Researchers believe that graphene reinforced rubber could be used to make thinner, stronger and stretchier condoms, gloves, sportswear or medical devices. \n\nCredit:\nGraphene and water-based elastomers thin-film composites by dip-moulding\nMaria Iliut, Claudio Silva, Scott Herrick, Mark McGlothlin, Aravind Vijayaraghavan\nCarbon, doi:10.1016/j.carbon.2016.05.032", "channelTitle": "SciNews", "tags": ["Graphene", "elastomer"], "defaultAudioLanguage": "en", "publishedAt": "2016-05-20T14:37:44Z", "channelId": "UCjU6ZwoTQtKWfz1urL7XcbA", "title": "Graphene reinforced rubber is 50% more rubbery"}, "id": "5q5dCuptXmc", "statistics": {"commentCount": "6", "viewCount": "1745", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "14"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.future.2016.06.013", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.future.2016.06.013", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT27M11S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Giveaway: https://www.circuitspecialists.com/giveaway\nCircuit Specialists Sonoluminescence Page: http://tiny.cc/sonoluminescence\n_________________________________________________________________\n\nSonoluminescence is probably one of the coolest phenomena you'll come across and involves conditions that over a fraction of a millisecond swing from -269C degrees to upwards of 10000C. By trapping a bubble with ultrasound you can force it to expand and then suddenly contract and in the moment of peak compression out comes a flash of light. In this video we explore how you can easily recreate this effect with very minimal hardware, and some of the other times this effects shows up, like when a mantis shrimp punches things. \n\nThisoldtony video - https://youtu.be/pFeek0a8s7Q\nElectroboom Vido - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9po11qjCWxA\n_________________________________________________________________\n*More resources*\n\nI'm going to supply these primarily as a list of DOI numbers. using less (or no) material to deliver the same service\nEnergy conservation - using less energy by adjusting behavior (turning down your heat)\nEnergy efficiency - using less energy by using technology that requires less energy to perform the same function (insulating your house to keep warm while using less energy)\nEnergy intensity - energy consumption per unit of GDP (reduced by increasing energy efficiency)\nEnergy services - the useful functions you're able to perform by using energy (what we refer to as \u2018function\u2019)\n___________________________________________\nIf you liked this week\u2019s video, you might also like: \nPhones are great for the environment https://www.wired.com/story/iphone-environment-consumption/\nNope, phones are bad for the environment https://theconversation.com/how-smartphones-are-heating-up-the-planet-92793\nAmory Lovins on \u2018integrative design\u2019 (watch the video abstract) - https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1748-9326/aad965/meta\nThe US would use 85% more energy if it weren\u2019t for efficiency efforts since the 1970s https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/energy-environment/308170-cheap-clean-and-easily-accessible-an-energy-resource\nUS energy intensity has halved since 1970 https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=10191\nThis chart shows just how much energy the US is wasting https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2018/05/visualizing-u-s-energy-consumption-in-one-chart\n_________________________________________\nSubscribe to MinuteEarth on YouTube: http://goo.gl/EpIDGd\nSupport us on Patreon: https://goo.gl/ZVgLQZ\nAnd visit our website: https://www.minuteearth.com/\n\nSay hello on Facebook: http://goo.gl/FpAvo6\nAnd Twitter: http://goo.gl/Y1aWVC\n\nAnd download our videos on itunes:  https://goo.gl/sfwS6n\n___________________________________________\nCredits (and Twitter handles):\nScript Writer, Editor and Video Narrator: Alex Reich (@alexhreich)\nVideo Illustrator: Sarah Berman (@sarahjberman)\nVideo Director: David Goldenberg (@dgoldenberg)\nWith Contributions From: Henry Reich, Kate Yoshida, Ever Salazar, Peter Reich, Juli\u00e1n G\u00f3mez, Arcadi Garcia\nMusic by: Nathaniel Schroeder: http://www.soundcloud.com/drschroeder\n\n\n___________________________________________\n\nReferences:\n\nBelkhir, L., & Elmeligi, A. 2018. cheap and easy fabrication of hydrogel actuators"}, "id": "HWW-lTXcK2I", "statistics": {"commentCount": "3", "viewCount": "1849", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "3", "likeCount": "35"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.future.2017.04.009", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.future.2017.04.009", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT5M39S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Perioperative care can bring many challenges to all persons involved in the process. Medical practitioners are constantly concerned about patient safety, relaying information appropriately and the importance of informed decisions. Patients are sometimes provided with documentation to educate themselves about the procedure, which differs greatly from one physician to another. We assume that patients have read and understood the details about their surgery but how do we really know the patient understands the concerns and risks? If a patient had questions before signing the final consent form, how would they get those questions answered? The problem is that clinicians are spending a considerable amount of time answering questions, drawing diagrams and walking patients through steps of the surgery, while part of this education process could be done differently and more consistently. This video looks at a potential solution to this problem through the effective use of a mobile health application.\n\nThis video was made by McMaster MSc eHealth students Mahnoor Waseem, Scott Currie, Sankavi Muralitharan and Vanessa Boudreau\n\nCopyright McMaster University 2018\n\nReferences: \n\n1. JBI Database of Systematic Reviews and Implementation Reports, 3(3), 1-31. doi:10.11124/01938924-200503030-00001", "channelTitle": "Demystifying Medicine", "tags": ["McMaster University", "Demystifying Medicine", "perioperative", "surgery", "mobile application", "patient education", "perioperative patient education"], "defaultAudioLanguage": "en", "publishedAt": "2019-03-02T18:09:02Z", "channelId": "UCEwEYnO7yey-oBzyNu-AauQ", "title": "Video-based mobile application for perioperative patient education"}, "id": "FZUYvIp0tAM", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "240", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "2"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.future.2017.05.037", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.future.2017.05.037", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT47M"}, "snippet": {"description": "\u201cWhat economists obsess about is equality of opportunity\u2026 What they miss is equality of agency. How do we make equality of agency happen? How do we bridge those discriminatory boundaries that exist in the world? \u2026 That\u2019s where anthropologists can contribute: by thinking through those issues in a creative way.\u201d\n\nVijayendra Rao (www.vijayendrarao.org), lead economist at the World Bank in the research department, talks to our own Ian Pollock about the role that anthropology and ethnography could play in helping poor or disempowered people engage with powerful institutions, and his frustration with a discipline that only critiques, and won\u2019t commit to promoting the development project. We also get into the cultures of development itself: the faddishness of ideas, the reliance on scale and quantification, the bureaucratic inertia, and the ways that ordinary people--their cultures, struggles, and aspirations--can be missing from the picture.\n\nDr Rao also gave a talk at ANU\u2019s Development Policy Centre, on the World Bank Social Observatory: \u201cintegrating the social sciences for adaptive practice.\u201d You can listen to it here: https://soundcloud.com/devpolicy/the-social-observatory-integrating-the-social-sciences-for-adaptive-practice\n\nQUOTES\n\n\u201cAs social scientists, we\u2019re not writing novels. We\u2019re trying to represent, quote-unquote, \u2018the truth\u2019 in some way.\u201d\n\n\u201cThere is a lot of qualitative work done, a lot of quantitative work done, that doesn\u2019t meet standards of rigor from any discipline... Because the imperative is not scholarship, the imperative is either some sort of packaging, or selling a product, or getting funders interested, or whatever.\u201d\n\n\u201cCreating goals for change, creating processes to achieve those goals, so that it leaves something behind... how do you make that change happen, how do you make it happen over the long term? That requires, in my mind, a process of co-production. It\u2019s a process of dialogue. How do you bring dialogue into interventions, is really what I think our goal should be as development practitioners, and development researchers even. Which is not yet the common practice.\u201d\n\n\u201cThe notion of a \u2018best practice\u2019 is the most unhealthy thing in development.\u201d\n\n\u201cWhy can\u2019t an anthropologist learn how to contribute towards design? Learn how to contribute towards processes of co-production? Learn how to make human beings actually matter in the process by which decisions are made?\u201d\n\n\u201cThe big difference between colonialism and development should be that \u2018beneficiaries\u2019 are being facilitated to have a voice in how they are being \u2018helped.\u2019 And I think how you do that, where you do that from, how all that comes in, how you change processes to make that happen, how you institute change to make that happen, that\u2019s where anthropologists could play a very important role. And they\u2019re not doing so.\u201d\n\nCITATIONS and LINKS\n\nAppadurai, A. (2004) \u201cThe Capacity to Aspire.\u201d In Rao, V., & Walton, M. (2004). Culture and public action. "10.1016/j.future.2017.11.025", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.future.2017.11.025", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT1M32S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Tourism Management Perspectives January 2018 Special Issue: Top Tourism Thoughts - https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/tourism-management-perspectives/vol/25/suppl/C\n\n\nResearch on hospitality and tourism education: Now and future\nHyun Jeong Kim & Miyoung Jeong\n\nAbstract: The education-related topics that have been favored by hospitality and tourism scholars in recent years are presented in this opinion paper. We categorized them into six groups: leadership and human capital development, teaching methods with the emphasis on active and experiential learning, online education, diversity education, internationalization, and industry experience. In addition, we shared our thoughts on additional research topics, reflecting the emerging trends in the hospitality and tourism industry as well as hospitality and tourism academia. Specifically, those thoughts include the development of undergraduate students' cultural competency, issues on hospitality and tourism PhD programs, full-fledged online curricula, and relationships with alumni and advisory board. It is our hope that this article provides some insights regarding the current status of hospitality and tourism education, and stirs up interest in education-related research within hospitality and tourism.\n\nAccess: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.tmp.2017.11.025", "title": "Tourism Education (Hyun Jeong Kim & Miyoung Jeong, 2018)", "publishedAt": "2018-02-11T06:30:28Z", "channelTitle": "Tourism Management Perspectives", "channelId": "UCOEnHtChguUPw_VAWQWSeBA"}, "id": "f9ZqUSowP_Q", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "45", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "1"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.future.2017.11.025", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.future.2017.11.025", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT53M36S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Department of Medicine Grand Rounds presentation by Dr. Clyde W. Yancy, MD, Vice Dean, Diversity and Inclusion; Magerstadt Professor of Medicine; Professor of Medical Social Sciences; \nChief of Cardiology, Department of Medicine; Northwestern University, Feinberg School of Medicine\n\n\nFailure Congestive Heart Failure Australia Cardiac Contractility Modulation\n\nAustralian Medical Supply Company - Life Systems Medical is supplying a new Heart Failure Device called the Optimizer which is designed to improve the condition of Heart Failure patients in Australia.\n\n\n Heart failure is a chronic disease requiring lifelong management. Some forms of heart failure are treated with drugs or with implanted devices such as pacemakers and implantable cardiac defibrillators. However, these treatments are not suitable for all patients and do not always result in an improvement of symptoms. The Optimizer IVs System with CCM technology has been developed to help ease the symptoms in most patients where other treatments are either not applicable or have proven to be minimally effective\nwww.lifesystems.com.au phone 03 925 5888", "channelTitle": "Life Systems Medical Australia", "tags": ["heart failure", "heart", "faiure", "hart", "hart fail", "heart faylure", "congestive heart failure", "congestive", "heartfaulure", "implantable heart", "heart help", "new device", "cardiologist", "cardiology", "heart failure treatment", "heart failure in australia", "australian patients with heart failure", "congestive heart failure in australia", "congestive heart failure treatment", "what to do if you have heart failure"], "publishedAt": "2018-07-11T05:30:02Z", "channelId": "UCmW_ZEqnpLh3Yme8dMkWr1g", "title": "Heart Failure Care in 2018  still a work in progress  Dr Yancy Northwestern University Feinberg"}, "id": "rG-OypbhK24", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "126", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "2"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.future.2017.11.026", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.future.2017.11.026", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT17M28S"}, "snippet": {"description": "This is another presentation that I gave during my urology subspeciality. {"q": "10.1016/j.is.2017.11.001", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.is.2017.11.001", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT12M33S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Bilaterians, the kind of creature we are most familiar with, have dominated the Animal Kingdom for well over half a billion years. But for tens of millions of years, they were just an odd collection of tiny bottom feeders. However, once bilateral symmetry evolved, it was poised and ready to seize the stage. This moment in time is known as \u201cthe Cambrian Explosion\u201d.  But how exactly did bilaterians manage to take over in the end? What kickstarted the Cambrian Explosion and can we expect the same thing to happen in alien biospheres? Was the Cambrian Explosion destined to happen or just a fortunate fluke? Would bilaterally symmetrical animals always evolve on Earth-like worlds? Let\u2019s try to find out!\n\nCHAPTERS\n0:00 Introduction\n1:07 Origin of Bilaterians\n3:25 Causes of the Cambrian Explosion\n7:20 Universal Trends for Planetary Biospheres\n10:17 Alien Biosphere Evolution \n11:37 Closing thoughts\n\nSOCIAL MEDIA: \nTwitter: https://twitter.com/Phrenotopian\nReddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/phrenotopia/\n\nREFERENCES \n - Prieto-Barajas CM et al (2018) \"Microbial mat ecosystems: Structure types, functional diversity, and biotechnological application\" Electronic Journal of Biotechnology - 31, 48-56 |  https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ejbt.2017.11.001\n - Hoyal Cuthill JF & Morris SC (2017) \"Nutrient-dependent growth underpinned the Ediacaran transition to large body size.\" Nature Ecology and Evolution 1, 1201-1204\n - Bobrovskiy et al. Incluye el trabajo de un equipo multidisciplinar que, desde la consulta hasta el smartphone, brinda al participante una experiencia de p\u00e9rdida de peso transformadora. Tambi\u00e9n puede informarse en www.allurion.com.com\n\n\u00bfCu\u00e1les son las ventajas del Programa Elipse?\n- Simplicidad: El Bal\u00f3n Elipse se ingiere en una visita breve de 20 minutos. Sin cirug\u00eda, endoscopia ni anestesia*.\n- Asistencia: Los pacientes reciben asistencia m\u00e9dica y nutricional a lo largo de todo el programa. Tambi\u00e9n se les entrega una b\u00e1scula conectada para que controlen sus avances.\n- Resultado: El Bal\u00f3n Elipse permite iniciar el programa de p\u00e9rdida de peso d\u00e1ndole una sensaci\u00f3n de saciedad y estimulando la adopci\u00f3n de nuevos h\u00e1bitos.\n\n*Solo en muy raros casos, El bal\u00f3n Elipse puede requerir endoscopia o intervenci\u00f3n quir\u00fargica para su extracci\u00f3n.\n\n\u00bfCu\u00e1les son los resultados que cabe esperar?\no Estudios cl\u00ednicos publicados en julio y diciembre 2017 sobre el Bal\u00f3n Elipse muestran una perdida de peso de promedio de 13 a 15 kg\u00b9,\u00b2. \n\nEl resultado var\u00eda de un paciente a otro. Un peque\u00f1o porcentaje de pacientes no reacciona al tratamiento.\n\n\u00b9Raftopoulos and Giannakou. Surg Obes Relat Dis. 2017 Jul;13(7):1174-1182.\n\u00b2Al Sabah et al. [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT30S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Discover the Elipse Balloon Weight Loss Program and kick-start your weight loss journey today! Find your nearest clinic at https://allurion.com\n\nWhat is the Elipse Balloon Weight Loss Program?\nThe Elipse Program is a 6-month comprehensive weight loss program built around the Elipse Balloon, a breakthrough weight-loss device. The Elipse Balloon is a soft balloon placed in your stomach. It is the first gastric balloon that requires no surgery, endoscopy, or anesthesia for placement or removal*. The balloon is placed during a brief 20-minute outpatient visit. After approximately 16 weeks, it empties and passes naturally.\n\nThe Elipse Program includes the Elipse Balloon for approximately 4 months, a 6-month medical and nutritional support, including one month before placement, and one month after the balloon passes. Patients receive a \u201csmart\u201d connected scale and mobile app, that allows them to monitor and share their progress with their healthcare team. \n\nAccording to a recent clinical study, on average, after 16 weeks of Elipse therapy, patients lost on average between 13 and 15 kg. Find your nearest clinic at https://allurion.com\n\nWhat is the Elipse Balloon Weight Loss Program?\nThe Elipse Program is a 6-month comprehensive weight loss program built around the Elipse Balloon, a breakthrough weight-loss device. The Elipse Balloon is a soft balloon placed in your stomach. It is the first gastric balloon that requires no surgery, endoscopy, or anesthesia for placement or removal*. The balloon is placed during a brief 20-minute outpatient visit. After approximately 16 weeks, it empties and passes naturally.\n\nThe Elipse Program includes the Elipse Balloon for approximately 4 months, a 6-month medical and nutritional support, including one month before placement, and one month after the balloon passes. Patients receive a \u201csmart\u201d connected scale and mobile app, that allows them to monitor and share their progress with their healthcare team. \n\nAccording to a recent clinical study, on average, after 16 weeks of Elipse therapy, patients lost on average between 13 and 15 kg. \u05d4\u05ea\u05d0\u05d9\u05dd, DNA, \u05ea\u05d0\u05d9 \u05d2\u05d6\u05e2 \u05de\u05e4\u05e0\u05d9 \u05e0\u05d6\u05e7\u05d9 \u05d4\u05d7\u05de\u05e6\u05d5\u05df. \nCoq-10 "10.1016/j.is.2017.12.001", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT1M36S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Dr. Mohammed Al Kuwari, well renowned in Qatar for his established medical practice, has successfully placed over 400 Elipse Balloons since 2016. In this video, he shares his experience with administering the Elipse Balloon and results he observed in his patients. For more information - https://allurion.com/en/\n\nWhat is the Elipse Balloon Weight Loss Program?\nThe Elipse Program is a 6-month comprehensive weight loss program built around the Elipse Balloon, a breakthrough weight-loss device. The Elipse Balloon is a soft balloon placed in your stomach. It is the first gastric balloon that requires no surgery, endoscopy, or anesthesia for placement or removal*. The balloon is placed during a brief 20-minute outpatient visit. After approximately 16 weeks, it empties and passes naturally.\n\nThe Elipse Program includes the Elipse Balloon for approximately 4 months, a 6-month medical and nutritional support, including one month before placement, and one month after the balloon passes. Patients receive a \u201csmart\u201d connected scale and mobile app, that allows them to monitor and share their progress with their healthcare team. \n\nAccording to a recent clinical study, on average, after 16 weeks of Elipse therapy, patients lost on average between 13 and 15 kg. However, the classic features are readily provided by patients during history taking. Migraine-associated dizziness and vertigo is a common mimicker of Meniere Disease which can also be managed initially by the family physician, with consideration given to a referral to neurology or neurotology (subspecialty of otolaryngology). As peripheral vestibular disorders are uncommon causes of attacks of dizziness and patient-reported vertigo, the first step in the approach to patients with dizziness or vertigo is delineating between true vertigo and other causes of dizziness. Treatment of Meniere's Disease ranges from conservative through nonablative to occasionally ablative therapies. Conservative therapy with nursing begins with diet modification and betahistine, which can be initiated by the family physician. Referral to an otolaryngologist is recommended for all patients suspected of having Meniere Disease. Most patients with Meniere's Disease obtain good control of their symptoms with exercises, personalized treatment and management.\n\n\nReference:\nKoenen L, Andaloro C. Meniere Disease. Esther Zorio sobre su art\u00edculo El grosor y una expresi\u00f3n de miARN alterada en la grasa epic\u00e1rdica se asocian con enfermedad coronaria en v\u00edctimas de muerte s\u00fabita, publicado en el n\u00famero de enero de 2019 en Rev Esp Cardiol. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.recesp.2017.12.003", "channelTitle": "Sociedad Espa\u00f1ola de Cardiolog\u00eda", "tags": ["Revista Espa\u00f1ola de Cardiolog\u00eda", "Rev Esp Cardiol", "REC", "V\u00eddeo", "Muerte s\u00fabita", "microARV", "microRNA", "Grasa epic\u00e1rdica", "miARN", "enfermedad coronaria"], "defaultAudioLanguage": "es", "publishedAt": "2018-12-20T15:00:00Z", "channelId": "UCsySMJfKVnZZudEJCKy8wHA", "title": "Grasa epic\u00e1rdica y muerte s\u00fabita cardiaca isqu\u00e9mica. Esther Zorio"}, "id": "Fh35ZHp9o5Q", "statistics": {"viewCount": "1281", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "1", "likeCount": "15"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.is.2017.12.003", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.is.2017.12.003", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT1M10S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Tourism Management Perspectives January 2018 Special Issue: Top Tourism Thoughts - https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/tourism-management-perspectives/vol/25/suppl/C\n\n\nNew technologies in tourism: From multi-disciplinary to anti-disciplinary advances and trajectories\nMarianna Sigala\n\nAbstract: Technologies transform tourism management and marketing from a static and utilitarian sense (whereby managers and tourists use technologies as tools) to a transformative conceptualization whereby tourism markets and actors both shape and are shaped by technology. This paper unravels the transformative power of technologies on: the tourism actors and resources (both the traditional but also new actors, i.e. the technology agents); the ways actors interact to (co-)create but also (co-)destruct tourism value; and the context in which tourism actors interact from a linear supply chain tourism \u2018industry\u2019 to a complex socio-technical smart tourism ecosystem. To study such complex phenomena and transformations, the paper emphasises that research should not only adopt a multi-disciplinary approach, but it also needs to follow an anti-disciplinary thinking whereby new knowledge and constructs do not simply fall within existing paradigms, disciplinary silos and mindsets once developed by studying the \u2018pure\u2019 humans and their behaviours.\n\nAccess: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.tmp.2017.12.003\n\n--\n\nFrom digitization to the age of acceleration: On information technology and tourism\nPhil Xiang\n\nAbstract: This essay presents an overview of the research development over the last twenty years on information technology and tourism. It argues that knowledge created in the last two decades can be characterized as consisting of two distinct eras, i.e., Digitization (1997\u20132006) and Age of Acceleration (2007\u20132016), which reflected the general understanding of how technology has transformed our society and economy. Knowledge development within each of these eras is examined in terms of the technological conditions, dominant paradigms, main research questions, and influential discipline and research approaches. Particularly, it recognizes the shift of our view of information technology in tourism research from a primarily a marketing-driven tool to a knowledge creation tool due to new technological conditions such as the smartphone, drone, wearables, new connectivity and big data. Finally, this essay discusses possible future research problems and challenges our existing views of the relationship between information technology and tourism.\n\nAccess: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.tmp.2017.11.023", "channelTitle": "Tourism Management Perspectives", "tags": ["Technology in tourism", "Tourism Management Perspectives", "Phil Xiang", "Marianna Sigala"], "publishedAt": "2018-02-11T06:04:47Z", "channelId": "UCOEnHtChguUPw_VAWQWSeBA", "title": "Technology in Tourism (Phil Xiang / Marianna Sigala, 2018)"}, "id": "i5rS_UTRcYc", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "253", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "2"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.is.2017.12.003", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.is.2017.12.003", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT3M54S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Today's vlog will be talking about how livestreams have digitised the music industry and the concert scene. Victor Hugo de Oliveira Henrique (UNEMAT) \nMestranda Larissa Gabriela Araujo Goebel \n____________________________________________\n\u27a1\ufe0f Sobre o conferencista:\nPossui gradua\u00e7\u00e3o em Licenciatura Plena em Ci\u00eancias Biol\u00f3gicas pela Universidade do Estado de Mato Grosso, Mestrado e Doutorado em Ecologia e Conserva\u00e7\u00e3o da Biodiversidade pela Universidade Federal de Mato Grosso. Desde 2004, venho desenvolvendo atividades de pesquisa e exten\u00e7\u00e3o em Biodiversidade de Formigas Amaz\u00f4nicas. Tenho como Interesses principais: Biologia, Ecologia e Sistem\u00e1tica de Formicidae; Diversidade e Hist\u00f3ria Natural de Artr\u00f3podes terrestres; Intera\u00e7\u00e3o Animal-Planta; Biologia da Conserva\u00e7\u00e3o e Padr\u00f5es de estrutura\u00e7\u00e3o de comunidades\n\nRefer\u00eancias utilizadas:\n- MYRMECOLOGIA\n* Projeto Formigas do Brasil: https://formigasdobrasil.com/o-projeto/ \n* Imagens de esp\u00e9cies montadas:  www.antweb.org\n* Imagens de formigas em campo:  https://www.alexanderwild.com/\n* Distribui\u00e7\u00e3o de esp\u00e9cies: www.antmaps.org\n* AntCat: An Online Catalog of the Ants of the World by Barry Bolton: https://www.antcat.org/ \n\n- LIVROS:\nGuia para os g\u00eaneros de formigas do Brasil: http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.32912\nFormigas do Alto Tiete: https://www.canal6.com.br/formigas/Formigas_do_alto_tiete_completo.pdf\nAs formigas poneromorfas do Brasil: http://www.uesc.br/editora/livrosdigitais2016/as_formigas_poneromorfas.pdf\nFauna de formigas (Insecta, Hymenoptera, Formicidae). In: Biodiversidade do Parque Estadual Cristalino: https://zenodo.org/record/3725047#.Xxc9XBJ7mpo\n\n- PALESTRAS, ARTIGOS E REVIS\u00d5ES TEM\u00c1TICAS\n* Parasitismo \nZumbifica\u00e7\u00e3o de formigas por fungos patog\u00eanicos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XvYeUeC7JZ4&t=4s\nDo zombie ant fungi turn their hosts into light seekers?: dx.doi.org/10.1093/beheco/ary198\n* Mutualismo: \nIntera\u00e7\u00f5es mutual\u00edsticas entre formigas e plantas: https://doi.org/10.12741/ebrasilis.v2i2.44\n* Dispers\u00e3o de sementes \nAnts as diaspore removers of non\u2010myrmecochorous plants: a meta\u2010analysis: https://doi.org/10.1111/oik.06940\nAnt removal distance, but not seed manipulation and deposition site increases the establishment of a myrmecochorous plant: https://doi.org/10.1007/s00442-019-04551-5 \nSeed manipulation by ants: disentangling the effects of ant behaviours on seed germination: https://doi.org/10.1111/een.12655 \nExploring the vegetation: Seed harvester ants climb and remove seeds from a giant cactus in a semiarid environment: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jaridenv.2018.05.002 \nComplex foraging ecology of the red harvester ant and its effect on the soil seed bank: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.actao.2017.12.003 \n* Poliniza\u00e7\u00e3o\nAnt pollination of Paepalanthus lundii (Eriocaulaceae) in Brazilian savana: https://doi.org/10.1093/aob/mcz021\nPollen adaptation to ant pollination: a case study from the Proteaceae: https://doi.org/10.1093/aob/mcaa058\nIn search of unusual interactions. Sfakianakis,Anapafseos 5 Agios Nikolaos 72100 Crete Greece,00302841026182,00306932607174,alsfakia@gmail.com,\r\nhttps://plus.google.com/communities/115462130054650919641?sqinv=VFJWaER0c2NCRl9ERzRjZWhxQmhzY09kVV84cjRn\r\n,\r\n,https://plus.google.com/u/0/+AlexandrosGSfakianakis\r\n,\r\nhttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQH21WX8Qn5YSTKrlJ3OrmQ\r\n,\r\nhttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTREJHxB6yt4Gaqs4-mLzDA\r\n,\r\nhttps://twitter.com/g_orl?lang=el,\r\nhttps://www.instagram.com/alexandrossfakianakis/,\r\n\r\nArticle in Press\r\nTrends in Singing Voice Research: An Innovative Approach\r\nPedro Melo Pestana'Correspondence information about the author Pedro Melo PestanaEmail the author Pedro Melo Pestana, Vaz Freitas Susana, Maria Concei\u00e7\u00e3o Manso\r\nDOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.jvoice.2017.12.003\r\nshowArticle Info\r\nAbstract\r\nFull Text\r\nImages\r\nReferences\r\nSummary\r\nObjectives\r\nThe objectives of this study were to trace and describe research patterns in singing voice, to compare the amount of published research over time, to identify journals that published most papers on \u201csinging voice,\u201d and to establish the most frequent research topics.\r\n\r\nMaterials and Methods\r\nThe study uses qualitative and quantitative approaches through descriptive statistics, text mining, and clustering. The authors conducted a search to identify scientific papers. The titles and abstracts were analyzed regarding word frequency and relations between them, through hierarchical cluster analysis and co-occurrence networks. The frequency of journals was calculated, as well as the amount of papers across time.\r\n\r\nResults\r\nSince 1949, 754 papers were published and an increase was noticed. Even though 162 journals were identified by the authors, the Journal of Voice holds the majority of papers, in every analyzed period. An evolution of studied topics is described. Up to 2010, the main theme was professional singers, especially classical and opera interpreters. Since then, voice quality and the effects of training gathered more attention.\r\n\r\nConclusions\r\nThe growing interest in singing has been conspicuous since the first indexed paper. However, it has been slightly slowing down. Until 2010, great importance was given to the voice quality of singers and their occupational demands. Acoustic analysis was widely used to study the effects of training. Since 2010, the concern with functionality is increasing, rather than the organic voice structures. Musical perception studies have been a trend, as well as the use of electroglottography.\r\n\r\nKey Words:\r\nSinging, Voice, Clustering, Text mining, Scientometry\n\r\n\r- video upload powered by https://www.TunesToTube.com", "channelTitle": "Alexandros G. Sou m\u00e9dica em Cuiab\u00e1 (CRM-MT 7565) e especialista em emerg\u00eancias pedi\u00e1tricas (RQE 5305).\n\nAqui voc\u00eas ir\u00e3o aprender sobre as emerg\u00eancias pedi\u00e1tricas de forma descomplicada e objetiva.\n\n Voc\u00ea faz plant\u00f5es na emerg\u00eancia e sempre que chega alguma crian\u00e7a mais grave voc\u00ea n\u00e3o sabe o que fazer? N\u00e3o se sente seguro? \nFica mais nervoso que a m\u00e3e e parece que tudo some da cabe\u00e7a? Ent\u00e3o este \u00e9 o seu lugar. \nAqui n\u00f3s vamos aprender a organizar o raciocino cl\u00ednico e tratar de maneira simples e objetiva. \n \nSe voc\u00ea \u00e9 estudante de medicina, m\u00e9dico residente, cl\u00ednico geral, pediatria ou apenas se interessa pelo assunto n\u00e3o deixe de se inscrever neste canal, ativar as notifica\u00e7\u00f5es no sininho ai embaixo \u00e0 direita para que voc\u00ea fique sabendo quando sair v\u00eddeo novo no canal  e tamb\u00e9m curtir esse v\u00eddeo. Assim voc\u00ea est\u00e1 me ajudando a divulgar essas informa\u00e7\u00f5es, melhorar o atendimento \u00e0s nossas crian\u00e7as, fazer mais alunos passarem nas provas de resid\u00eancia e a fazer o canal crescer.\n\nMeu nome \u00e9 Ma\u00edsa Talon, sou graduada e fiz resid\u00eancia em Pediatria pela Universidade Federal de Mato Grosso, sou especialista em emerg\u00eancias pedi\u00e1tricas pela Sociedade Brasileira de Pediatria e atuo como professora em duas faculdades de medicina de Cuiab\u00e1.\n\nEste v\u00eddeo inaugural \u00e9 sobre o atendimento inicial as crian\u00e7as gravemente enfermas. Sem o dom\u00ednio desse conte\u00fado \u00e9 praticamente imposs\u00edvel conduzir adequadamente uma emerg\u00eancia. \nEnt\u00e3o fiquem comigo at\u00e9 o final do v\u00eddeo que tem muito conte\u00fado bacana para voc\u00eas.\n\nSigam-me nas redes sociais e tirem suas d\u00favidas!\nInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/maisatalon.pedurgente\n\nREFER\u00caNCIAS BIBLIOGR\u00c1FICAS:\nFernandez Ana, Benito Javier, Mintegi Santiago. Epub 2017 Aug 25.\n\noriginal unedited vignette retrieved from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VWrEh24Gsls", "channelTitle": "ezabla01 SA", "tags": ["pre-hospital", "emergency", "primary survey", "pediatrics"], "publishedAt": "2018-08-08T12:19:39Z", "channelId": "UCyaqgCW16hteWKZJZ1nUQnA", "title": "Is this child sick?"}, "id": "dhDzznX0g4E", "statistics": {"commentCount": "0", "viewCount": "71", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "0"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.im.2017.07.002", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.im.2017.07.002", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT2M47S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Chen Feng, Yuichi Taguchi \n\nFasTFit: A fast T-spline fitting algorithm \n\nAccepted to Computer-Aided Design \nVolume 92, November 2017, Pages 11-21 \n\nAbstract: \nT-spline has been recently developed to represent objects of arbitrary shapes using a smaller number of control points than the conventional NURBS or B-spline representations in computer aided design, computer graphics, and reverse engineering. However, existing methods for fitting a T-spline over a point cloud are slow. By shifting away from the conventional iterative fit-and-refine paradigm, we present a novel split-connect-fit algorithm to more efficiently perform the T-spline fitting. Through adaptively dividing a point cloud into a set of B-spline patches, we first discover a proper topology of T-spline control points, i.e., the T-mesh. We then connect these B-spline patches into a single T-spline surface with different continuity options between neighboring patches according to the data. The T-spline control points are initialized from their correspondences in the B-spline patches, which are refined by using a conjugate gradient method. In experiments using several types of large-sized point clouds, we demonstrate that our algorithm is at least an order of magnitude faster than state-of-the-art algorithms while provides comparable or better results in terms of quality and conciseness. \n\nJournal page: \nhttps://doi.org/10.1016/j.cad.2017.07.002", "channelTitle": "Mitsubishi Electric Research Labs (MERL)", "tags": ["Point cloud", "T-Spline Fitting"], "publishedAt": "2017-09-07T20:17:27Z", "channelId": "UCaIX7kwu7svua9ozA7PPvMg", "title": "FasTFit: A fast T-spline fitting algorithm"}, "id": "-R-HzUATnqI", "statistics": {"viewCount": "425", "favoriteCount": "0", "dislikeCount": "0", "likeCount": "3"}}]}, {"q": "10.1016/j.im.2017.07.002", "idx_paper": "10.1016/j.im.2017.07.002", "items": [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT2M58S"}, "snippet": {"description": "This is a short video highlighting some motivations for intimate partner homicide and familicide, using psychological theory to help explain these acts. \nFor more detailed information on the topic, read the following Wikiversity book chapter: https://en.wikiversity.org/wiki/Motivation_and_emotion/Book/2018/Familicide_motivation\n\nThis presentation has a Creative Commons licence, reuse is allowed. \n\n-- Created using Powtoon -- Free sign up at http://www.powtoon.com/youtube/ -- Create animated videos and animated presentations for free. {"description": "Collaborative consumption (CC) is an increasingly prevalent form of exchange. CC occurs within a triangle of actors: a platform provider (e.g., Uber), a peer service provider (e.g., an Uber driver) and a customer. The platform provider's main role is matchmaking, so that a customer can access assets of a peer service provider. \n\nIn this video is based on an academic article in which three criteria to delineate CC from related constructs such as access-based consumption, sharing or renting are identified. And we talk thoroughly about each of these reasons and so much more.\n\n1. They are not based on any valid science. There are no studies that provide evidence that staffing ratios alone will improve quality of care. In fact, many of the studies that the union cites the most say the exact opposite.\n\n2. The ratios are the same for each unit in every hospital on both night and day shifts \u2014 from the largest teaching hospitals in Boston to smaller, rural hospitals in Western Massachusetts. But each hospital is unique, each unit is different, each nurse is different and each patient population is different.\n\n3. The mandate does not account for the acuity of the patient or the experience of nurses working on the unit at that time. Recent nursing graduates would have the same patient responsibilities as nurses with twenty years of experience. As nurses, we know that doesn\u2019t make any sense.\n\nAll the links from the conversation!\n\nPatient Satisfaction with Hospital Care and Nurses in England: An Observational F\u00fchle Dich bitte auch dazu ermutigt das hier vermittelte Wissen mit Deiner Community zu teilen - sei es auf Twitter, WhatsApp, Facebook, oder anderen Social Media Kan\u00e4len. \n\nAlle Videos werden vor Ver\u00f6ffentlichung noch einmal von einer Diplom-Psychologin gepr\u00fcft, weswegen Empalogics auch auf einen festen Uploadplan verzichtet.\nUmso wichtiger ist es, dass Du den Kanal abonnierst und die Glocke aktivierst, so dass Dir keines der Videos entgeht!\n\n\u25ac Empalogics im Netz \u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\n\nWebseite      \u25ba http://empalogics.de\nTwitter          \u25ba http://twitter.com/empalogics\n\n\u25ac Hilfe bei Notf\u00e4llen \u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\u25ac\n\n0800 - "snippet": {"description": "Article in Press\r\nLong-term Average Spectra Analysis of Voice in Children With Cleft Palate\r\nZengjie Yang'Correspondence information about the author Zengjie YangEmail the author Zengjie Yang, Jincai Fan, Jia Tian, Liqiang Liu, Cheng Gan, Tiran Zhang, Zheng Liu, Bing Han\r\nNinth Department of Plastic Surgery, Plastic Surgery Hospital of Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Beijing, China\r\nDOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.jvoice.2017.05.008\r\nshowArticle Info\r\nAbstract\r\nFull Text\r\nImages\r\nReferences\r\nSummary\r\nObjectives\r\nThe purpose of this study was to survey the spectral characteristics and to compare, using an acoustic analyzer, the objective data obtained from patients with cleft palates with the objective data of normal children using long-term average spectra (LTAS) analysis.\r\n\r\nMethods\r\nParticipants were divided into a clinical group and a control group. All participants were asked to practice reading a sentence to become fluent. The duration of each recording was about 60 seconds. All samples were subjected to acoustic analysis using Praat software. All recordings were analyzed acoustically using LTAS.\r\n\r\nResults\r\nIn this study, there was no significant difference between the control group and the clinical group in the low-frequency region (boys: 0\u20132720\u2009Hz; girls: 0\u20132240\u2009Hz). LTAS measurements showed a great difference between the control group and the clinical group in the middle-frequency region (boys: 2720\u20134000\u2009Hz; girls: 2240\u20134000\u2009Hz). We also found that the energy distributed in the clinical group was lower than that of the control group in the high-frequency region (4000\u2009Hz\u20138000\u2009Hz) in both boys and girls.\r\n\r\nConclusions\r\nThe results reveal a lack of flat region in the middle-frequency range in the clinical group (both boys and girls) in comparison with the control group. The results also reveal that there is no significant difference across the control group and the clinical group in the low-frequency region.\r\n\r\nKey Words:\r\nLong-term average spectra (LTAS), Acoustic analyzer, Cleft palate, Spectra analysis, Velopharyngeal insufficiency\n\r\n\r- video upload powered by https://www.TunesToTube.com", "channelTitle": "Alexandros G. [{"contentDetails": {"duration": "PT6M18S"}, "snippet": {"description": "Brearley MB. Should Workers Avoid Consumption of Chilled Fluids in a Hot and Humid Climate? Saf Health Work. 2017 Dec;8(4):327-328.\n\nAuthor information\nAbstract\nDespite provision of drinking water as the most common method of occupational heat stress prevention, there remains confusion in hydration messaging to workers. During work site interactions in a hot and humid climate, workers commonly report being informed to consume tepid fluids to accelerate rehydration. When questioned on the evidence supporting such advice, workers typically cite that fluid absorption is delayed by ingestion of chilled beverages. Presumably, delayed absorption would be a product of fluid delivery from the gut to the intestines, otherwise known as gastric emptying. Regulation of gastric emptying is multifactorial, with gastric volume and beverage energy density the primary factors. If gastric emptying is temperature dependent, the impact of cooling is modest in both magnitude and duration (\u2264\u00a05\u00a0minutes) due to the warming of fluids upon ingestion, particularly where workers have elevated core temperature. Given that chilled beverages are most preferred by workers, and result in greater consumption than warm fluids during and following physical activity, the resultant increased consumption of chilled fluids would promote gastric emptying through superior gastric volume. Hence, advising workers to avoid cool/cold fluids during rehydration appears to be a misinterpretation of the research. More appropriate messaging to workers would include the thermal benefits of cool/cold fluid consumption in hot and humid conditions, thereby promoting autonomy to trial chilled beverages and determine personal preference. In doing so, temperature-based palatability would be maximized and increase the likelihood of workers maintaining or restoring hydration status during and after their work shift.\nKEYWORDS:\nFluid consumption; gastric emptying; hot and humid conditions; hydration; occupational\nPMID: 29276629 PMCID: PMC5715486 DOI: 10.1016/j.shaw.2017.07.001\n2017\u5e74\u4e00\u7bc7\u91ab\u5b78\u6587\u737b\u300c\u5728\u9ad8\u6eab\u6fd5\u71b1\u74b0\u5883\u5de5\u4f5c\u7684\u4eba\u662f\u5426\u61c9\u8a72\u907f\u514d\u559d\u51b0\u6c34\uff1f\u300d\u767c\u73fe\uff0c\u50b3\u7d71\u89c0\u5ff5\u5efa\u8b70\u4eba\u5011\u5728\u5929\u71b1\u6d41\u6c57\u6642\uff0c\u61c9\u8a72\u559d\u6eab\u6c34\u907f\u514d\u812b\u6c34\u4e2d\u6691\uff0c\u7576\u8a62\u554f\u9019\u7a2e\u5efa\u8b70\uff08\u70ba\u4ec0\u9ebc\u662f\u559d\u6eab\u71b1\u7684\u6c34\u800c\u4e0d\u662f\u51b0\u6c34\uff1f\uff09\u7684\u7406\u8ad6\u57fa\u790e\u6642\uff0c\u4e00\u822c\u90fd\u56de\u7b54\u8aaa\uff0c\u56e0\u70ba\u51b0\u6c34\u6703\u6e1b\u5c11\u6c34\u4efd\u7684\u5438\u6536\u3002\n\u5438\u6536\u7684\u5feb\u6162\u6307\u7684\u662f\u300c\u80c3\u6392\u7a7a\u300d\u7684\u901f\u5ea6\uff0c\u4e5f\u5c31\u662f\u98df\u7269\u5f9e\u80c3\u90e8\u9032\u5230\u8178\u5b50\u4e2d\u88ab\u5438\u6536\u7684\u901f\u5ea6\u3002\n\u8abf\u7bc0\u300c\u5438\u6536\u5feb\u6162\u300d\u7684\u56e0\u7d20\u5f88\u591a\uff0c\u6700\u4e3b\u8981\u7684\u6709\u5169\u500b\uff0c\u4e00\u500b\u662f\u5403\u9032\u53bb\u7684\u9ad4\u7a4d\uff0c\u4e00\u500b\u662f\u80fd\u91cf\u7684\u5bc6\u5ea6\u3002\u9ad4\u7a4d\u8d8a\u5927\u3001\u80fd\u91cf\u5bc6\u5ea6\u8d8a\u9ad8\u5438\u6536\u8d8a\u6162\uff0c\u53cd\u4e4b\u5247\u8d8a\u5feb\u3002\n\u5373\u4fbf\u80c3\u6392\u7a7a\u7684\u901f\u5ea6\u8ddf\u98f2\u6599\u7684\u6eab\u5ea6\u6709\u95dc\uff0c\u8003\u91cf\u5230\u5728\u9ad8\u6eab\u6fd5\u71b1\u74b0\u5883\u4e2d\u5de5\u4f5c\u7684\u4eba\u4e2d\u6a1e\u9ad4\u6eab\u4e0a\u5347\uff0c\u4ee5\u53ca\u5f9e\u8003\u69cd\u9032\u5165\u6d88\u5316\u9053\u5f8c5\u5206\u9418\u5167\u98f2\u6599\u7684\u6eab\u5ea6\u5c31\u5df2\u7d93\u4e0a\u5347\u5230\u9ad4\u6eab\u4e86\uff0c\u5f71\u97ff\u50c5\u80fd\u7b97\u662f\u4e2d\u5ea6\u4e14\u77ed\u66ab\u7684\uff08\u5c0f\u65bc5\u5206\u9418\uff09\n\n\u53c3\u8003\u8cc7\u6599\uff1a\n\nClive M. \u043e\u0441\u043e\u0431\u0435\u043d\u043d\u043e\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0439: \n\u0426\u0411 \u043c\u044f\u0433\u043a\u0430\u044f; \n\u0426\u0411 \u044d\u043b\u0430\u0441\u0442\u0438\u0447\u043d\u0430\u044f;  \n\u0426\u0411 \u0432\u043d\u0430\u0447\u0430\u043b\u0435 \u043d\u0435 \u0438\u043c\u0435\u0435\u0442 \u043e\u0447\u0430\u0433\u043e\u0432\u043e \u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0437\u0430,\n\u0426\u0411 \u043f\u0440\u043e\u043f\u0443\u0441\u043a\u0430\u0435\u0442 \u043a\u0440\u043e\u0432\u044c \u0432\u043d\u0443\u0442\u0440\u0438 \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0438,\n\u0426\u0411 \u043d\u0430\u0445\u043e\u0434\u0438\u0442\u0441\u044f \u0432\u043d\u0443\u0442\u0440\u0438 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430;\n\u0426\u0411 \u043c\u043d\u043e\u0433\u043e \u0432\u0440\u0435\u043c\u0435\u043d\u0438 \u043d\u0435 \u043f\u0440\u0438\u043a\u0440\u0435\u043f\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0430 \u043a \u0441\u0442\u0435\u043d\u043a\u0435 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430 \u0438 \u043c\u043e\u0436\u0435\u0442 \u0431\u044b\u0442\u044c \u043b\u0435\u0433\u043a\u043e \u0438\u0437\u0432\u043b\u0435\u0447\u0435\u043d\u0430 \u0438\u0437 \u043d\u0435\u0433\u043e \u0441 \u043f\u043e\u043c\u043e\u0449\u044c\u044e \u043f\u0440\u043e\u0441\u0442\u044b\u0445 \u0438\u043d\u0441\u0442\u0440\u0443\u043c\u0435\u043d\u0442\u043e\u0432; \n\u0426\u0411 \u043c\u043e\u0436\u0435\u0442 \u0438\u043c\u0435\u0442\u044c \u0440\u0430\u0437\u043d\u0443\u044e \u0434\u043b\u0438\u043d\u0443 (\u044f \u0432\u0438\u0434\u0435\u043b \u043d\u0430 \u0432\u0438\u0434\u0435\u043e \u0441\u0432\u044b\u0448\u0435 10 \u0441\u043c); \n\u0426\u0411 \u043f\u043e\u0441\u0442\u043e\u044f\u043d\u043d\u043e \u043a\u043e\u043d\u0442\u0430\u043a\u0442\u0438\u0440\u0443\u0435\u0442 \u0441 \u043a\u0440\u043e\u0432\u044c\u044e;\n\u0426\u0411 \u0447\u0435\u0442\u043a\u043e \u043f\u043e\u0432\u0442\u043e\u0440\u044f\u0435\u0442 \u043a\u043e\u043d\u0442\u0443\u0440\u044b \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430; \n\u0426\u0411 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0442\u043e\u0438\u0442 \u0438\u0437 \"\u0447\u0438\u0441\u0442\u043e\u0433\u043e\" \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u0430; \n\u0426\u0411 \u043c\u043e\u0436\u0435\u0442 \u0431\u044b\u0442\u044c \u043d\u0435\u0441\u043a\u043e\u043b\u044c\u043a\u043e \u0432 \u043e\u0434\u043d\u043e \u0438 \u0442\u043e\u0436\u0435 \u0432\u0440\u0435\u043c\u044f;\n\u0426\u0411 \u043c\u043e\u0433\u0443\u0442 \u0431\u044b\u0442\u044c \u043e\u0434\u043d\u043e\u0432\u0440\u0435\u043c\u0435\u043d\u043d\u043e \u0432 \u043c\u043e\u0437\u0433\u0435, \u0432 \u0441\u0435\u0440\u0434\u0446\u0443\u0435 \u0438 \u0434\u0440\u0443\u0433\u0438\u0445 \u0430\u0440\u0435\u0442\u0440\u0438\u044f\u0445. \u0426\u0438\u043b\u0438\u043d\u0434\u0440\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0430\u044f \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0430 (\u0426\u0411) \u043e\u0442\u043b\u0438\u0447\u0430\u0435\u0442\u0441\u044f \u043e\u0442 \u043a\u043b\u0430\u0441\u0441\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u043e\u0439 \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u043e\u0432\u043e\u0439 \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0438 (\u041a\u0410\u0411):\u041a\u0410\u0411  \u0440\u0430\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u0434\u043e\u043b\u0433\u043e (\u0433\u043e\u0434\u0430\u043c\u0438 \u0434\u0435\u0441\u044f\u0442\u0438\u043b\u0435\u0442\u0438\u044f\u043c\u0438); \u041a\u0410\u0411  \u0440\u0430\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u0432\u043d\u0443\u0442\u0440\u0438 \u0441\u0442\u0435\u043d\u043a\u0438 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430 (\u043f\u043e\u0434 \u0438\u043d\u0442\u0438\u043c\u043e\u0439), \u043d\u0435\u043b\u044c\u0437\u044f \u0443\u0434\u0430\u043b\u0438\u0442\u044c \u043d\u0435 \u043f\u043e\u0432\u0440\u0435\u0434\u0438\u0432 \u0441\u0442\u0435\u043d\u043a\u0443 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430; \n\u041a\u0410\u0411 \u043d\u0435 \u043a\u043e\u043d\u0442\u0430\u043a\u0442\u0438\u0440\u0443\u0435\u0442 \u0441 \u043a\u0440\u043e\u0432\u044c\u044e; \n\u041a\u0410\u0411 \u043f\u0435\u0440\u0435\u0436\u0438\u043c\u0430\u0435\u0442 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434 \u0441 \u043e\u0434\u043d\u043e\u0439 \u0441\u0442\u043e\u0440\u043e\u043d\u044b; \n\u041a\u0410\u0411 \u0440\u0430\u0441\u043f\u043e\u043b\u0430\u0433\u0430\u0435\u0442\u0441\u044f  \u043b\u043e\u043a\u0430\u043b\u044c\u043d\u043e \u0438 \u043a\u0430\u043a \u043f\u0440\u0430\u0432\u0438\u043b\u043e \u043d\u0435\u0442 \u043e\u0434\u043d\u043e\u0432\u0440\u0435\u043c\u0435\u043d\u043d\u043e \u043f\u043e\u0445\u043e\u0436\u0438\u0445 \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u0435\u043a \u043d\u0430 \u043e\u0434\u043d\u043e\u0439 \u0441\u0442\u0430\u0434\u0438\u0438 \u0440\u0430\u0437\u0432\u0438\u0442\u0438\u044f;\n\u041a\u0410\u0411 \u0441\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0430\u044e\u0442 \u043f\u0440\u043e\u0431\u043b\u0435\u043c\u0443 \u0441\u043f\u043e\u043d\u0442\u0430\u043d\u043d\u043e, \u043b\u043e\u043a\u0430\u043b\u044c\u043d\u043e,  \u0447\u0435\u0440\u0435\u0437 \u0434\u043b\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u044c\u043d\u043e\u0435 \u0432\u0440\u0435\u043c\u044f, \u0437\u0430 \u044d\u0442\u043e \u0432\u0440\u0435\u043c\u044f \u041a\u0410\u0411 \u0443\u0441\u043f\u0435\u0432\u0430\u0435\u0442 \u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0437\u0438\u0440\u043e\u0432\u0430\u0442\u044c\u0441\u044f - \u0438\u043c\u0435\u043d\u043d\u043e \u043e\u0442\u0441\u044e\u0434\u0430 \u043f\u043e\u044f\u0432\u0438\u043b\u0441\u044f  \u0442\u0435\u0440\u043c\u0438\u043d \"\u0430\u0442\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0437 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u043e\u0432\" \u0441\u0432\u044f\u0437\u0430\u043d\u043d\u044b\u0439 \u0441 \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u043e\u0432\u043e\u0439 \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u043e\u0439 - \u0438\u043c\u0435\u0435\u0442\u0441\u044f  \u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0442\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0430\u044f \u0442\u043a\u0430\u043d\u044c \u0432 \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0435 \u0438 \u0435\u0441\u0442\u044c \u043f\u043e\u0432\u0440\u0435\u0436\u0434\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u043e\u0432.\n\n\u0426\u0411 \u043c\u043e\u0436\u0435\u0442 \u0443\u0431\u0438\u0442\u044c \u0438\u043b\u0438 \u043f\u043e\u043a\u0430\u043b\u0435\u0447\u0438\u0442\u044c \u0434\u0430\u0436\u0435 \u0430\u0431\u0441\u043e\u043b\u044e\u0442\u043d\u043e \u0437\u0434\u043e\u0440\u043e\u0432\u043e\u0433\u043e \u0447\u0435\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0435\u043a\u0430  \u0432 \u0442\u0435\u0447\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0438 \u043d\u0435\u0441\u043a\u043e\u043b\u044c\u043a\u0438\u0445 \u0434\u043d\u0435\u0439. \u0418\u043c\u0435\u043d\u043d\u043e \u043e\u043d\u0430 \u0442\u0435\u0441\u043d\u043e \u0441\u0432\u044f\u0437\u0430\u043d\u0430  \u0441 \u043f\u043e\u0432\u044b\u0448\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435\u043c \u0443\u0440\u043e\u0432\u043d\u044f \u043f\u043b\u043e\u0445\u043e\u0433\u043e \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u0430 \u0432 \u043a\u0440\u043e\u0432\u0438. \u0418 \u0437\u0430 \u0432\u0441\u0435\u043c \u044d\u0442\u0438\u043c \u0441\u0442\u043e\u0438\u0442 \u043d\u0435\u0440\u0432\u043d\u043e\u0435 \u043f\u0435\u0440\u0435\u043d\u0430\u043f\u0440\u044f\u0436\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435 \u043f\u0440\u0438 \u0441\u0442\u0440\u0435\u0441\u0441\u0435, \u0432\u0435\u0433\u0435\u0442\u043e-\u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0438\u0441\u0442\u0430\u044f \u0434\u0438\u0441\u0442\u043e\u043d\u0438\u044f, \u043d\u0435\u043f\u0440\u0430\u0432\u0438\u043b\u044c\u043d\u043e\u0435 \u043b\u0435\u0447\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435 \u0433\u0438\u043f\u0435\u0440\u0442\u043e\u043d\u0438\u0438, \u043a\u043e\u0442\u043e\u0440\u044b\u0435 \u043f\u0440\u0438\u0432\u043e\u0434\u044f\u0442  \u043a \u0441\u0438\u043b\u044c\u043d\u043e\u043c\u0443  \u0441\u043f\u0430\u0437\u043c\u0443 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u043e\u0432- \u0441\u0438\u043b\u044c\u043d\u0435\u0435 \u0447\u0435\u043c \u043f\u0440\u0438 \u043e\u0431\u044b\u0447\u043d\u043e\u043c \u0434\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0438.\n  \n\u0426\u0411 \u0438\u043c\u0435\u0435\u0442 \u043d\u0435\u0441\u043a\u043e\u043b\u044c\u043a\u043e \u0441\u0442\u0430\u0434\u0438\u0439 \u0440\u0430\u0437\u0432\u0438\u0442\u0438\u044f:\n- \u0440\u044b\u0445\u043b\u0430\u044f \u0426\u0411 - \u043b\u0438\u043f\u043e\u043f\u0440\u043e\u0442\u0435\u0438\u0434\u044b \u0435\u0449\u0435 \u043d\u0435 \u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0438\u043b\u0438\u0441\u044c \u043c\u0435\u0436\u0434\u0443 \u0441\u043e\u0431\u043e\u0439 - \u0443\u0447\u0430\u0441\u0442\u0432\u0443\u0435\u0442 \u0432 \u043f\u043e\u0432\u044b\u0448\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0438 \u0443\u0440\u043e\u0432\u043d\u044f \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u0430 \u0432 \u043a\u0440\u043e\u0432\u0438;\n- \u043c\u044f\u0433\u043a\u0430\u044f \u0426\u0411 -  \u043b\u0438\u043f\u043e\u043f\u0440\u043e\u0442\u0435\u0438\u0434\u044b \u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0438\u043b\u0438\u0441\u044c \u043c\u0435\u0436\u0434\u0443 \u0441\u043e\u0431\u043e\u0439 - \u044d\u0442\u043e \u0442\u0430 \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0430, \u043a\u043e\u0442\u043e\u0440\u0430\u044f \u043b\u0435\u0433\u043a\u043e \u0432\u044b\u043d\u0438\u043c\u0430\u0435\u0442\u0441\u044f \u0438\u0437 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430;\n- \u043f\u043b\u043e\u0442\u043d\u0430\u044f \u0426\u0411 - \u0431\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0435 \u0433\u0440\u0443\u0431\u043e\u0435 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0442\u043e\u044f\u043d\u0438\u0435 \u0438 \u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0438\u0432\u0430\u0435\u0442\u0441\u044f \u0441\u043e \u0441\u0442\u0435\u043d\u043e\u043a\u0439 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430 -\u0442\u044f\u0436\u0435\u043b\u043e \u0432\u044b\u043d\u0443\u0442\u044c \u0438\u0437 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430;\n- \u0441\u0442\u0430\u0440\u0430\u044f \u0426\u0411 - \u0438\u043c\u0435\u044e\u0442\u0441\u044f \u0434\u0435\u0444\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0430\u0446\u0438\u0438 \u0441\u0442\u0435\u043d\u043a\u0438 \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0438, \u043e\u0447\u0430\u0433\u0438 \u043d\u0435\u043a\u0440\u043e\u0437\u0430 - \u043e\u0447\u0435\u043d\u044c \u0442\u044f\u0436\u0435\u043b\u043e \u0432\u044b\u043d\u0443\u0442\u044c \u0438\u0437 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u0430.\n\n\u041f\u0440\u0438 \u0434\u043b\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u044c\u043d\u043e\u043c \u0441\u043f\u0430\u0437\u043c\u0435 \u043f\u043e\u043b\u043d\u043e\u0441\u0442\u044c\u044e \u0444\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0438\u0440\u0443\u0435\u0442\u0441\u044f \u0446\u0438\u043b\u0438\u043d\u0434\u0440\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0430\u044f \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u043e\u0432\u0430\u044f \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0430, \u043a\u043e\u0442\u043e\u0440\u0430\u044f \u043f\u0435\u0440\u0435\u043a\u0440\u044b\u0432\u0430\u0435\u0442 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434 \u0438 \u043c\u043e\u0436\u0435\u0442 \u0432\u044b\u0437\u0432\u0430\u0442\u044c \u043e\u0441\u0442\u0440\u044b\u0439 \u0438\u043d\u0444\u0430\u0440\u043a\u0442  (\u0432 \u043b\u0435\u0433\u043a\u0438\u0445 \u0441\u043b\u0443\u0447\u0430\u044f\u0445 - \u0441\u0442\u0435\u043d\u043e\u043a\u0430\u0440\u0434\u0438\u044e \u043f\u043e\u043a\u043e\u044f) \u0438 \u043e\u0441\u0442\u0440\u044b\u0439 \u0438\u043d\u0441\u0443\u043b\u044c\u0442, \u0430 \u0442\u0430\u043a\u0436\u0435 \u0432\u0441\u0435 \u0432\u043c\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435. \n  \n\u041f\u0440\u0438 \u043a\u0440\u0430\u0442\u043a\u043e\u0432\u0440\u0435\u043c\u0435\u043d\u043d\u043e\u043c \u043f\u043e\u0432\u044b\u0448\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0438 \u0434\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u044f \u0432\u044b\u0448\u0435 \"\u043d\u043e\u0440\u043c\u044b\" \u0447\u0435\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0435\u043a \"\u043f\u0440\u043e\u0441\u0442\u043e\" \u0438\u043c\u0435\u0435\u0442  \u043f\u043e\u0432\u044b\u0448\u0435\u043d\u043d\u044b\u0439 \u0443\u0440\u043e\u0432\u0435\u043d\u044c \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u0430 \u0432 \u043a\u0440\u043e\u0432\u0438.   \n\n\u0426\u0438\u043b\u0438\u043d\u0434\u0440\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0443\u044e \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u043e\u0432\u0443\u044e \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0443 \u043d\u0435\u043b\u044c\u0437\u044f \u043d\u0430\u0437\u0432\u0430\u0442\u044c \u043f\u0440\u043e\u044f\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435\u043c \"\u0430\u0442\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0437\u0430\" \u0432 \u0447\u0438\u0441\u0442\u043e\u043c \u0432\u0438\u0434\u0435. \"\u0410\u0442\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0441\u043a\u043b\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0437\" \u0441 \u0426\u0411  - \u044d\u0442\u043e \u0431\u043e\u043b\u044c\u0448\u0435 \u043e\u0431\u0449\u0435\u043f\u0440\u0438\u043d\u044f\u0442\u044b\u0439 \u0442\u0435\u0440\u043c\u0438\u043d, \u043a\u043e\u0442\u043e\u0440\u044b\u043c \u043e\u0431\u043e\u0437\u043d\u0430\u0447\u0430\u044e\u0442 \u0437\u0430\u043a\u0443\u043f\u043e\u0440\u043a\u0443 \u0441\u043e\u0441\u0443\u0434\u043e\u0432.   \n\n\u0416\u0443\u0440\u043d\u0430\u043b \"\u043c\u0435\u0434\u0438\u0446\u0438\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0438\u0435 \u0433\u0438\u043f\u043e\u0442\u0435\u0437\u044b\" \u2116106 2017 \u0433\u043e\u0434\u0430 \u0441\u0442\u0440 61-70 \u043e\u043f\u0438\u0441\u0430\u043d\u0430 \u0434\u0430\u043d\u043d\u0430\u044f \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u043a\u0430, \u043e\u043f\u0438\u0441\u0430\u043d\u044b \u044d\u0442\u0430\u043f\u044b \u0435\u0435 \u0440\u0430\u0437\u0432\u0438\u0442\u0438\u044f, \u043a\u0430\u043a \u043e\u043d\u0430 \u043f\u043e\u044f\u0432\u043b\u044f\u0435\u0442\u0441\u044f, \u043a\u0430\u043a \u0432\u044b\u0437\u044b\u0432\u0430\u0435\u0442 \u043f\u043e\u0432\u044b\u0448\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435 \u0445\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u043d\u0430 \u0432 \u043a\u0440\u043e\u0432\u0438. \u043a\u0440\u0430\u0442\u043a\u043e \u0435\u0441\u0442\u044c \u0432 \u043a\u043e\u0440\u043e\u0442\u043a\u043e\u043c \u0432\u0438\u0434\u0435\u043e \u043d\u0430 \u043f\u043e\u043b\u0442\u043e\u0440\u044b \u043c\u0438\u043d\u0443\u0442\u044b \n\nThe affection of the disturbance of the hydrodynamics of blood in case of stress on pathological increase of level of low density lipoproteins in blood. The formation of cylindrical plaques, and their participation in the development of acute ischemic disorders of heart and brain.\nhttps://doi.org/10.1016/j.mehy.2017.07.001  \n\n\u041f\u0435\u0440\u0435\u0432\u043e\u0434 \u0441\u0442\u0430\u0442\u044c\u0438 \u0432 \u0436\u0443\u0440\u043d\u0430\u043b\u0435 \u041c\u0435\u0434\u0438\u0446\u0438\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0438\u0435 \u0424\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0438\u0440\u043e\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0438\u0435 \u0446\u0438\u043b\u0438\u043d\u0434\u0440\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0438\u0445 \u0431\u043b\u044f\u0448\u0435\u043a
